boardgame.name: The Isle of the Dead: Tropical
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mysterious jungle island, difficult to find, and the resting place of the dead


A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting The Isle of the Dead, in a tropical setting - with ruins and catacombs containing tombs

boardgame.name: Old Scoter Crash Site
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oh no - the Old Scoter, that veritable veteran ship - has crashed on a terrible alien-swamp-planet!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Wargame game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting a the crash site of the Old Scoter on an alien swamp forest.
The set includes intact alien forest, as well as the crashed ship with both exterior and interior views.

boardgame.name: Arrowhead Lighthouse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Safeguarding the coast, the lighthouse is a beacon to passing ships
Arrowhead Lighthouse is a printable RPG floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.
Contents: A 30x30 battlemap depicting the a lighthouse on a rocky headland. The map is provided in day and night variants (light on and off), plus interiors.

boardgame.name: Arrowhead Point
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Watching the sea from the headland that gives the location it's name, the bleak building gives no indication as to what is inside.
Arrowhead Point is a printable RPG floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.
Contents: A 30x30 battlemap depicting the surface. A stone building stands on the headland, over a grey and bleak sea. GMs can pick any of the 8 interior maps that are included in this set when the party explore the camp, making each encounter unique.

The interior maps include a ruined church, three wizard labs (two abandoned/corrupted), smuggler hideout, rebel base, noble hunting lodge and Cthulhu shrine.

The Discover Range features large surface battlemaps and smaller rooms and chambers. When your party enter the house, simply use the interior map of your choice. It can be different every time.

boardgame.name: Return to Greystone Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An expansive dungeon built under the ruins of Greystone Castle - it's easy to get lost!

Seven years ago we listed our first map on DrivethruRPG; Greystone Dungeon. To celebrate our 7th Birthday, we've returned!


A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A huge, expansive abandoned dungeon. Parts of the dungeon were built under Greystone Castle, including a prison, cellars, an undercroft and crypt. However, later users of the dungeon have expanded it to include catacombs and an arcane laboratory/temple.

boardgame.name: The Ruins of Greystone Castle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The remains of a huge crumbling castle, set in a bleak landscape. The castle sits above a vast dungeon.


A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: The ruins of a large castle, crumbling to rubble. The remains of a large castle, great hall, church and gatehouse can be made out.

boardgame.name: The Pines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an overlay for the game Cthulhu Dark that uses Lovecraftian horror themes to interrogate queer assimilationism through the lens of Fire Island Pines. The Pines is a tongue-in-cheek horror game that tasks players with creating a vacationer and setting out in the small island town of Fire Island Pines to find their missing friend before The Pines Party - only the party of the summer.

This is a pamphlet version with all the necessary setting materials for both players and a facilitator — perfect for a one-shot, a con game or to maximize portability!

boardgame.name: Gravestones (Issue 3)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the third issue of Gravestones. Inside is this issue you will find

Editorial pg. 3

New weapon: Pitchfork and Scythe Pg. 4

Creature Feature: Straw Golem pg. 5

On location: The Library Pg 6

New Template: Rancher pg. 11
boardgame.rpg: Trick or Treat Horror Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Lances and Steel: The Battle of Mokra, September 1, 1939
boardgame.description:
“The blow must be struck. We must act now or go under.” –Adolf Hitler.

“The marauders’ attack will be smashed against the steel wall of our heroic army.” –Dobry Wieczór Kuier Czerwony.

The German attack on Poland, codenamed “Case White,” on September 1st, 1939 was a gamble on Hitler’s part. He wagered Poland’s allies of France and Great Britain would once again cave-in to his demands and not oppose his invasion. Even if they did, a lightning-fast war (blitzkrieg) would make mote any of their objections once the rival to the east was subjugated. That a mutual defense treaty stipulating an invasion from the east by the Soviet Union only “sealed the deal” and further secured Hitler’s risk.

Lances and Steel is a war game simulation of the battle fought near the town of Mokra during the 1939 invasion of Poland by Nazi Germany. The area was held by the Polish 7th Infantry Division and the Wołyńska Cavalry Brigade supported by the Smialy armored train and the 21st Tank battalion. The German attack here sought to separate the Polish Lodz and Krakow Armies and effect a breakthrough to the Polish rear areas. The first major battle of WWII was fought here. Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and Enjoy!

Each turn of the game represents one and half hours of time. Most units represent a battalion; Polish armor units represent a company. Each hex is approximately one-third of a mile across.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of Lances and Steel.
Mounted counters are an additional $8.00.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: Gleam of Eternity
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Reach for Infinity!

In the far reaches of the Aurin system, where the distant sun is just another bright star, strange and ancient miracles permeate the cosmos, where the limits of both space and time bend and fray when the power of the mind interweaves with the substance of reality. Titanic mechanical moons have brought destructive change in their wake, and their weathered hulks linger in the shadows of shattered stars and planet-wide storms, yet even so the elder races of dragonkind and the younger folk of the system keep their eyes at once on the heavens above and the wild lands below, ever watchful for an irruption of the qlippoth and their chaos blight that can bring ruin to all. To those daring or reckless enough to delve their secrets, this aberrant expanse beyond the outer limits offers power beyond imagining.

Gleam of Eternity offers a wealth of new options for players, bringing the biohacker, vanguard, and witchwarper classes from the Starfinder Roleplaying Game to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, along with nearly 20 all-new archetypes like the biollurgist biohacker, stellar echo wilder, miracle soldier psychic warrior, and worldweaver psion, plus alternate class features and integration with expanded rules systems like psionics and Spheres of Power! You’ll also find over 80 new feats, spells, augmentations, combat talents, addictive power-boosting stimulants, and more to enhance your game, from Revenant Militia and powdered psicrystal to Vacuous Power and Reality-Puncturing Attack!

boardgame.name: Red Danube
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s 271 of the Common Era, and General Aurelian has defeated a host of rivals to become Lucius Domitius Aurelianus Augustus, the ruler of Rome. He faces a shattered empire, and enemies on every border. Marching on rebel Palmyra, he first faces an army of the Goths, and their king, Cannabas.

Your character are scouts and spies, forward elements of the Emperor Aurelian’s army during the Crisis of the Third Century. Aurelian has already taken the first steps to restore the world, but the obstacles before him are vast. You have crossed the Danube into territory threatened by the Gothic king Cannabas on a secret mission entrusted to you by the emperor himself. Alone in enemy territory, failure means death.

No problem. You’ve come, now it’s time to see, and later conquer.

This adventure for Centurion: Legionaries of Rome includes six pre-generated characters and usually runs between six and nine hours of play time.

boardgame.name: The Obelisk of Mentas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We told them we sought the secrets of the god Mentas. They told us we would need hats, which didn't really make sense until we saw the obelisk. Vultures have taken over the entire region, using their vile excrement to profane the god and all he stood for. Now, if we truly wish to understand a long-dead god, we'll have to climb...

This is a system-agnostic dungeon designed to slot easily into whatever kind of campaign you might be running. Use it as a random settlement, a random wilderness encounter, or a challenge to overcome in exchange for knowledge the party seeks.

boardgame.name: Lifeshapers 5 Volume I: Mutations
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lifeshapers 5 is a series of books on organic technology and mutations compatible 5th edition rules. Volume 1 introduces a new mutation system, four new races, and new feats. The book is a conversion of the original Lifeshapers book which used the 3.X d20 rules.

Lifeshapers 5 Volume 1: Mutations includes...

Four new playable races
Muglom: Shapeshifters that can imitate any shape, but perfecting forms takes time. 
Pank: A race of mutants each with unique abilities.
Quwek: A race body snatchers that can steal the identities of the dead. 
Thahazi: A race of parasites that survives by taking over the brains and nervous systems of other creatures.

A complete mutation system: Around 80 mutations and mutation upgrades, and 20 weaknesses.
Racial Feats: 18 racial feats for the races included in the book that improve on their natural traits.

boardgame.name: Items Most Wondrous II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the wondrous items in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Vulcanbridge 2.0 (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A thriving village is the last thing a traveller expects to find on a cracked and blasted volcanic plain belching lava and poisonous gases. However, Vulcanbridge defies expectations and offers a haven for wayward souls and desperate travellers alike. Primarily home to dwarven and gnomish engineers and miners, the village also attracts adventurers and greedy merchants keen to turn a healthy profit. The village relies on trading its considerable wealth for necessities, and this influx of wealth has also attracted the wrong kind of attention. Vulcanbridge seems like a tempting target to raiders who see an isolated village endowed with treasure. This threat adds to the dangers posed by the environment itself and the fiery creatures dwelling in the magmatic caverns beneath the plain. Then there are the dark rumours the deep-dwelling owner of all the treasure harvested by the villagers has awoken and intends to take it all back...

boardgame.name: Vulcanbridge 2.0 (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A thriving village is the last thing a traveller expects to find on a cracked and blasted volcanic plain belching lava and poisonous gases. boardgame.name: Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm: Volume 6 (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm is the largest, most comprehensive, most flexible, and most ambitious fantasy roleplaying bestiary ever conceived. 6,400 complete statblocks, comprising 1,600 monsters, each given the Quadded Statblock treatment, enabling them to be used in any campaign setting, with PCs of any level.

Add to this a thoroughly innovative and massively expandable AI system to guide monster behavior, and you have what just might be the most impressive and valuable creature resource ever to hit Pathfinder and 5E.

(Please note that Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm in its entirety is a six-volume set. This publication is the sixth of those six volumes, and contains 1,064 statblocks comprising 266 monsters. This book may be used in combination with any number of the other volumes, or on its own.)

This book is intended to be any or all of the following:

An authoritative listing of monsters for use in any campaign setting, for adventuring parties of any size, and any level.
A means of using any existing monster with adventures of any level and difficulty.
A compendium of newly-created monsters, born of inspiration from existing beasties you may already know and love.
A single-source reference and repository, listing every single possible monster in easy-to-reference alphabetical order.

boardgame.name: Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm: Volume 6 (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm is the largest, most comprehensive, most flexible, and most ambitious fantasy roleplaying bestiary ever conceived. 6,400 complete statblocks, comprising 1,600 monsters, each given the Quadded Statblock treatment, enabling them to be used in any campaign setting, with PCs of any level.

Add to this a thoroughly innovative and massively expandable AI system to guide monster behavior, and you have what just might be the most impressive and valuable creature resource ever to hit Pathfinder and 5E.

(Please note that Aquilae: Bestiary of the Realm in its entirety is a six-volume set. This publication is the sixth of those six volumes, and contains 1,064 statblocks comprising 266 monsters. This book may be used in combination with any number of the other volumes, or on its own.)

boardgame.name: The Tengapeng
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Abnormality Archives is a series of creature bestiary articles detailing new and unique monsters for your fantasy RPG games. System free and suitable for most generic FRPGs allowing the GM to stat out the creatures for your own game.


1 features the dreaded Tengapeng, a deadly tree dwelling apex predator, sure to wreak terror in your party!!

boardgame.name: Hand of the Deep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Abnormality Archives is a series of creature bestiary articles detailing new and unique monsters for your fantasy RPG games. System free and suitable for most generic FRPGs allowing the GM to stat out the creatures for your own game.


2 features the colossal Hand of the Deep, a gigantic sea dwelling human hand!

boardgame.name: The Hanged Ones
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Abnormality Archives is a series of creature bestiary articles detailing new and unique monsters for your fantasy RPG games. System free and suitable for most generic FRPGs allowing the GM to stat out the creatures for your own game.


3 details the vengeful dead, the Hanged ones!

boardgame.name: The Death Lighters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Abnormality Archives is a series of creature bestiary articles detailing new and unique monsters for your fantasy RPG games. System free and suitable for most generic FRPGs allowing the GM to stat out the creatures for your own game.


4 details the Death Lighters, a type of undead spirit charged with guiding those fated to die to the next world!

boardgame.name: The Pierian Dagger
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A little knowledge is a dangerous thing…the heroes discover the truth behind this old maxim for themselves when a simple run of cargo to a xenoarchaeological team on the planet Alkhost goes awry. The expedition seems to have unearthed secrets long-buried that should’ve stayed that way. But what secrets? And why is a tribe of barbarians willing to commit murder to protect them?

The Pierian Dagger is a short adventure for Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG.)

boardgame.name: External Factor: Cirque d'Galactique
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roys had just managed to close the voices out of his head when the arena’s lights dimmed. A spotlight pierced the darkness as a pounding rock beat shook the arena. The light focused on a slender woman with waist-length raven hair carrying herself with almost superhuman grace. Grasping a loop of cord, she ascended to a waiting platform high above the arena floor. Once aloft, she stepped onto the platform and discarded her line with a conspicuous flourish.

The girl danced lightly on the platform for a few moments, her movements designed to show the audience that she wore no safety gear of any kind. Then she danced to the edge of the platform…and deliberately pitched forward into space.

A gasp erupted from the stunned spectators. Roys scanned the plummeting form to see if she were wearing a grav belt. No, she wasn’t. The girl fell…10 meters…20…

But just before reaching the floor, the girl spread her arms and gracefully soared upward to thunderous applause. The aerialist flew around the perimeter of the venue as the audience went wild with excitement. When she reached Roys’ seat, she stopped directly in front of him, smilingly extending a hand.

“Go ahead, Roys. Take a chance,” a voice — a male voice — whispered in his head. Intrigued, Roys took the offered hand, which was placed firmly around the girl’s waist. Circling his waist with an equally sure grip, she took off again, the two of them effortlessly soaring high above the delighted attendees.

As they flew, the voice entered Roys’ head again. “We’re happy you’ve chosen to bring your gift to us, Roys. We know you have had trouble controlling it in the past. We can teach you how if you are willing to learn.”

External Factor: Cirque d’Galactique is an overview of an NPC organization for Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG), although it’s usable with other systems with a little work. The file includes a brief history of the circus; a discussion of its methods, motivations, reach, and influence; an overview of character types typically found working for the circus; and a set of stats compatible with those found in External Factors: Organizations.

And welcome to the greatest show not on Earth!

boardgame.name: 1917 Trench Raids
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

1917 Trench War is a campaign pack for Modern War, a Cepheus Engine-based game.

This is a roleplaying game set on the Western Front in 1917, where the players' unit faces an implacable foe across No Man's Land. Poison gas, machine guns, snipers and thickets of barbed wire have turned the conflict into siege warfare. Stalemate. To break that stalemate, daring commando raids are carried out.

Play as a small squad of night-time trench raiders, striking enemy posts and trenches, carrying out bombing raids, prisoner snatches, assaults and assassinations… And they used all kinds of improvised dress, equipment and weaponry, from entrenching tools as axes, iron plate as armour, and balaclavas and boiler-suits to break up their silhouette. These small teams went out into the dark often without back-up or any chance to call for help. They were on their own, facing life and death situations and thinking for themselves about what had to be done and how to survive and get back to their own lines.

Includes firearms for British and Commonwealth, French, German and US armies, as well as comprehensive rules on poison gas, sniping, barbed wire, trench fighting and operating at night. Three tanks are included, as well as a list of mission guidelines and random mission and encounter tables.

boardgame.name: Rolemaster Fanzine (Issue 31 - Nov 2019)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue 31 of the RolemasterBlog Fanzine. At the time of writing, there are 62 days left of 2019 and I really hope that the team at ICE hit their target of resolving RMu this year.

I don’t think that it will happen. Mainly because at the beginning of the month Creature Law was not complete, although everything else was in Nicholas’s editing queue. It is possible that Creature Law was finished and added to the queue this month but for anyone even reading the thousand or so pages of RMu in a month is quite an endeavor but to do it at an editors level is a lot to ask. Even if all of that has happened and there were no editing changes required one has to wonder about art.

Would you put our an entirely new edition of your game and reuse art from old versions? I wouldn’t. That means that there is a lot of art to commission. The art commissioning is something that Nicholas takes great pleasure in, and I understand why, but we haven’t heard those magic words yet. Given the amount of art needed, typically an RPG book has one piece of art for every four pages so there is going to be something like 300 pieces of art required. 62 days is a very short period for gathering that volume of art.

I really hope I am wrong but I think a Christmas release of RMu is unlikely.

This year was always about adventures in the fanzine and the Demon War is heading into what I will imagine to be the last third of the adventure path. Depending on your starting level you characters could be 12th level by now. It would be nice if I could get the entire thing concluded in 12 parts, this being the 9th.

boardgame.name: Rolemaster Fanzine (Issue 32 - Dec 2019)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue 32 of the RolemasterBlog Fanzine.

We now know that there will be no RMu in 2019. I am writing this on December 3rd we don’t have the December Directors Briefing either. It is my intention to “finish” the RMu Adventure Path this issue and then use the next few issues to expand the path outwards. By that I mean explore the roles of other playable races and add more side quests.

Right now, you have the linear path from mentor to show down. The first part of 2020 will be all about showcasing what RMu can do well by creating those side quests to emphasis specific rule sections.

The ground rules I have laid down of scalable encounters and threat levels means that any of these side quests can be played at any place in the adventure, geography allowing.

So those are my intentions but intentions get you nowhere if you don’t see them through. So here is the final episode of the adventure path.

boardgame.name: Sky Rogue
boardgame.description:
A "rogue-lite" arcade flight game. Fly a variety of planes into combat in randomly generated missions against ground and air targets.

A near future setting with mostly modern technology, but some more fantastical elements such as helicarriers and automated drone factories.

During play you acquire money that you use to upgrade weapons and planes, but you lose all upgrades and must restart when you die. However, you also accumulate tech points used to unlock new weapons and aircraft that persist.

(User review)

boardgame.name: Dungeon Vault Magazine (No. 9)
boardgame.description: This is issue No. 9 of Dungeon Vault Magazine. A compilation of adventures, lore, excellent cartography, and useful digital goodies.

boardgame.name: 50 Sea Dogs 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shiver me timbers! This list provides 50 detailed pirates and other scurvy ridden sea dogs to infest your ships and saucy portside taverns with. Included in each entry is the following: First name and surname, gender (most are males but there are a few lasses), a general descriptive element about the character, weapon(s) carried and used, coins on their person, and a special treasure/carried item.

Random roll the percentile dice to use just one or a few, or fill up that cursed old galleon with the whole wretched lot of these scoundrels!

This list is suitable for historical era and fantasy settings alike.

boardgame.name: 50 Sea Dogs 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shiver me timbers! This list provides 50 detailed pirates and other scurvy ridden sea dogs to infest your ships and saucy portside taverns with. Included in each entry is the following: First name and surname, gender (most are males but there are a few lasses), a general descriptive element about the character, weapon(s) carried and used, coins on their person, and a special treasure/carried item.

Random roll the percentile dice to use just one or a few, or fill up that cursed old galleon with the whole wretched lot of these scoundrels!

This list is suitable for historical era and fantasy settings alike.

boardgame.name: 100 Space Prisoners: Cell Block 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

More prisoners to fill up those star port holding cells, space station jail units, bounty hunter transports, and hulking prison ships. Included in this 100 list is the prisoner’s name, gender, and crime. Simply roll the percentile dice and you are on your way to populating the galaxy with an assortment of incarcerated scumbags! Need to fill up a lot of cells? Combine this release with earlier 100 Space Prisoners offerings!

boardgame.name: 100 College Kids Set 8
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different college students that the GM can drop into any scenario that they need. Though perfect for various modern settings (crime, drama, supers, etc.) this could also be used for generating survivors for post apocalypse or zombie outbreak settings. It could also perhaps be used for cyberpunk and dystopia settings.

Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, major of study, and a talent/hobby/interest that the college student has.

boardgame.name: 100 College Kids Set 9
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different college students that the GM can drop into any scenario that they need. Though perfect for various modern settings (crime, drama, supers, etc.) this could also be used for generating survivors for post apocalypse or zombie outbreak settings. It could also perhaps be used for cyberpunk and dystopia settings.

Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, major of study, and a talent/hobby/interest that the college student has.

boardgame.name: 100 College Kids Set 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different college students that the GM can drop into any scenario that they need. It could also perhaps be used for cyberpunk and dystopia settings.

Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, major of study, and a talent/hobby/interest that the college student has.

boardgame.name: Run Away From Space Dice Tower
宇宙逃げろ Dice Tower (Sora Nigero Dice Tower)
boardgame.description:
宇宙逃げろ Dice Tower (Sora Nigero Dice Tower) is a flat-packed dice tower produced by Game Nowa. The design is a simple baffle, with basic graphics and text from the game box.
user summary

boardgame.name: In Cold and Dicey Waters
boardgame.description:
The cold war between the Northern Coalition and the Southern Alliance is about to escalate!

In this competitive game for two to four players, you take control of a dice-powered attack submarine about to make contact with the enemy. The numbers and technological capabilties on both sides even out, so it is up to your wits and tactics to ensure that your side emerges from this first engagement with an advantage.

This is a free print & play game made for the "4th Roll & Write Contest" organized here in the BGG forums.

In Cold and Dicey Waters offers a competitive 1v1 or 2v2 experience based on action-programming, incomplete information and a moderate amount of dice rolling.

This game was specifically designed to feature good playability over video-chat software and only requires some dice, a pencil and one printed player sheet each. No cutting, no folding, no scissors, just symmetrical, tactical gameplay.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Rolemaster Fanzine (Issue 33 - Jan 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This will be the year of RMu. I am continuing the RMu adventure path series in 2020 by expanding the setting or world building, bringing in the other humanoid races and offering more side quests. If you haven’t been playing along as each month was released, you will have the option of inserting these added adventures into the path and give more options to your players.

If you are a regular on the blog you will know that I have horses, Icelandic horses. These horses are called Fönix and Hekla. The literal translations of those names are Phoenix and Gateway to Hell. Doesn’t that just sound like an adventure waiting to happen? The phoenix is the perfect symbol to use in a January issue as well with its new year and new beginnings connotations.

(No one actually named her Gateway to Hell, she is named after a volcano and the volcano happens to be called the gateway to hell.)

In this issue I will try and bring everything together, halflings, more setting information, at least one phoenix and some demons. What could possibly go wrong?

boardgame.name: Rolemaster Fanzine (Issue 34 - Feb 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is February 2020, and still no RMu.

In this issue the most exciting bit is my treatment of Dwarves in the adventure path setting. Before you get to that I have a few articles of general interest. The first is an article about AI, but I also want to look at mental health in PRGs and particular Rolemaster and accelerated development.

I have been playing with the idea of AI for a few months and thought it would make an interesting topic. It is also a project that is going to take a long time to complete because of the resources required. This will become a recurring theme.

boardgame.name: Rolemaster Fanzine (Issue 35 - Mar 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This month is the final (probably) part of the RMu Adventure Path. In addition, I have some Elven centered side quests, including lots of demons and an interesting encounter with a dragon, and who doesn't love a dragon in fantasy RPGs? I also present an interesting magic weapon and an update on my AI project.

Next month will be the 3rd Anniversary of the fanzine, so lookout for a special issue!

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition)
boardgame.description:
From the publisher’s website:

There is no time for peace. No forgiveness. No respite. There is only war.

The galaxy writhes in the mailed fist of all-consuming conflict. The Imperium of Mankind teeters on the brink of annihilation, beset upon all sides by heretic warlords, daemon-summoning witches and rapacious alien empires. In every star system and upon every planet, fierce battle rages as loyalists, heretics and aliens tear reality itself apart in their war for dominance. Every day the flames rise higher.

This is a more terrible era than ever before, and there is no peace amongst the stars...

The Book
A 368-page hardback, this is the essential book for any fan of Warhammer 40,000 – everything you need to know to collect, build, paint and play with Citadel miniatures.

It starts with an overview of the Warhammer 40,000 hobby, covering the four areas of Collect, Built, Paint and Play, including descriptions of open, matched, and narrative play.
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Chris played Warhammer 40K, Pikachu V is alive - Boards & Swords #176
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – Grand Tournament 2021 Mission Pack and Munitorum Field Manual 2021 MkII
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – Munitorium Field Manual 2021 Mk1
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – War Zone Nachmund Grand Tournament Mission Pack and Munitorum Field Manual 2022
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Blood Angels
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Dark Angels
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Space Wolves
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Crusade Mission Pack – Amidst the Ashes
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Crusade Mission Pack – Plague Purge
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Crusade Mission Pack – Wars of Faith
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Charadon – Act I: The Book of Rust
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Charadon – Act II: The Book of Fire
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Nachmund – Vigilus Alone
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Octarius – Book 1 – Rising Tide
Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): War Zone Octarius – Book 2 – Critical Mass
Warhammer 40,000: Chapter Approved Mission Pack – Tactical Deployment
Warhammer 40,000: Crusade Mission Pack – Beyond the Veil

listing.notes: New book from the Indomitus box set. Not looking to make profit just recoup my cost. The standard version of the book is MSRP $65. This book has the full art alt cover.

boardgame.name: Rolemaster Fanzine (Issue 36 - Jan 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It is April 2020, and the fanzine is 3 years old.

On my desk, well not really on my desk but you know what I mean, I have three adventures written by three different authors that all want RMC/RM2 and RMFRP/RMSS stats and conversions.

This is not about a growing interest in Rolemaster, I wish that it was, it is the result of me running around like a devil and offering to do the conversions for no upfront costs. I take a royalty on each copy sold, knowing full well that we are only talking about a handful of copies.

It is not about the money, it is about having a constant stream of new adventures for people who do want to play Rolemaster.

This issue is of course being written in the middle of the Coronavirus pandemic. I am witnessing a massive shift towards VTT, virtual table tops, to allow groups to grow. I am not a VTT fan, but I do enjoy solo play. I am obviously not alone in this as my Rolemaster compatible solo rules HASP, High Adventure Solo Play, has seen a boost in sales through March. Just do what you need to do to get your Rolemaster fix as long as you stay safe.

By the time you read this Navigator RPG 1st Edition will be at the printers. Why you should care about this is because Navigator RPG puts nearly all the core Rolemaster mechanics under the Open Gaming License. Anyone can take anything I have created and make their own adventures, supplements and games from it. Navigator RPG essentially guarantees Rolemaster’s core mechanics will be around forever.

In 2020 I will be taking Navigator RPG and making a Fantasy version. What Navigator RPG is to SpaceMaster, this new game will be to Rolemaster. The roadmap does not stop there either. I cannot put dates on them but a WWII game is lined up as is a Cthulhu mythos version. Ultimately I would like to see a GammaWorld style game and even a contemporary Vampire version. I cannot put timelines on these, it is going too far out into the future.

If the games are successful, which is a rather arbitrary concept in RPGs, I would like to put a team together to build and support the systems. I want to put the Rolemaster way into genres where we have never been before.

At the time of writing the ICE Forums are down again. This time they have been offline for 10 days. This is not good. In fact, I think it is worrying. Forum hosting is not brain surgery. If you cannot do it yourself there are a myriad of companies that will host a secure forum for you. All you have to do is pay.

But this seems beyond ICE.

I am slightly worried about the forums, as having no online presence in the build up to a major release is not good marketing. It is also rather disjointed in that ICE’s twitter feed is still going on, retweeting loads of other people’s stuff but not a mention of their own website being down.

I am starting to feel slightly let down by ICE. It feels like I care more about their survival than they do. I would not be in the slightest bit surprised if all of the regular forum contributors don’t feel the same.

Well, that seemed a bit negative. I am not one to roll over and cry woe is me! The rolemasterblog is going to keep on carrying on. We have more contributors than ever and what is more I am trying to catch up with getting this fanzine in print on Amazon, a task I fell well behind with. Rolemaster will always have a home, even if ICE shuts its doors yet again!

boardgame.name: Rolemaster Fanzine (Issue 37 - May 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This month we have a low-level adventure, Goblin Mine. An adventure designed to teach players to think smart. Charge! is not always the best tactic. Allegedly at least.

I also look at Blood Guts & Glory, Light Master and A Slight Mistake. All clones of Rolemaster and spacemaster.

Finally, I talk about Navigator RPG and Pilot RPG. The first is out now and the second is planned for late 2020.

boardgame.name: Rolemaster Fanzine (Issue 38 - Jun 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There was a bit of excitement this month when we heard that Hurin and Tbigness were going to be given some special RMu materials for GenCon. It is really sad that today Gen Con announced that the convention was cancelled for 2020.

We are now all waiting to see what happens in the Virtual GenCon!

In other news, and happier news Brian Hanson, Egdcltd and I are in discussion about producing another series of 50 adventures in 50 weeks. Only this time, making them a bit more substantial, more maps and more stats. We even want to cross stat them with other systems, in the hope of rekindling fond memories of Rolemaster with OSR dungeon crawling style players.

This Issue
This month we have two adventures. The first is a scalable adventure were you get to mess with your players by throwing curses at them. There are a few iconic monsters in the mix as well as an evil spell caster.

The second adventure is a higher level affair with the fearsome Shards at the heart of it.

boardgame.name: Rolemaster Fanzine (Issue 39 - Jul 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

GenCon is going to be a Virtual GenCon this year. That is better than cancelled, but I still think that it is a real shame that the Con could not go ahead. These are the times we live in, and we have to make the best of them as we can.

The most positive is that a version of RMu will be there to be played. Soon I will be able to drop the small ‘u’ and what we will have is RM, the one system to rule them all.

I hope that everyone reading this knows that the ICE forums are back online, with virtually no loss of data!

Adventures!
In this issue are two ‘sort of’ adventures. I blogged about this at the beginning of the month. Urban adventures are hard. Both the adventures I have written this month are more like subplots you can drop on to a town or city, and they could rumble on for a while mostly unnoticed. I wanted them to be aimed at low-level parties but the big bad in one of them is 20th level. It is not intended that the characters fight it, but then, sometimes hard lessons need to be learned.

The second adventure is inspired by the 1950s Invasion of the Body Snatchers. The foes for this adventure are 6th level and are intended to be met singly. This adventure could be for starting characters. Run them both at the same time and you are going really mess up a town!

These adventures were ‘requested’. If there is anything you want to see in the fanzine, please ask.

Arms Law
This issue has an article by Alfred Reibenschuh on the evolution of Arms Law, to coincide with the 40th Anniversary. Alfred gives you a welcome break from my normal drivelling!

boardgame.name: Go For Broke!: A World War II Miniatures Skirmish Game
boardgame.description:
Go For Broke! is an easy to learn, fun to master skirmish miniatures game! These rules provide everything you need to start using your collection of 25mm to 28mm World War II miniatures in pitched battles and daring scenarios. With these rules it is easy to create a “beer & pretzels” style game night or an in-depth mission with a realistic objective! So grab your dice, your little metal figures, maybe a tank or two, and prepare to Go For Broke!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Feats
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Today’s Unearthed Arcana presents a selection of new feats for Dungeons & Dragons. Each feat offers a way to become better at something or to gain a whole new ability.

boardgame.name: Declan L'Estrange
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This beautifully illustrated character playbook for the City of Mist RPG introduces Declan L'Estrange, a gunslinging antiques dealer who is living in a dream.

Declan perceives the world around him as a dream. It has not always been the case, but this is why he started searching the City far and wide for ancient artifacts and texts to help explain this mysterious and ethereal force that guides him.

Declan has been around the City long enough (even before opening up to his Mythos) to know that you have to keep an eye open for the first sign of trouble, and in order to survive in a world of betrayal and danger it's probably wiser to be packing a pistol or two...

boardgame.name: Scarlet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This beautifully illustrated character playbook for the City of Mist RPG introduces Scarlet, the Rift of Little Red Riding Hood.

Scarlet found the red hood on one fateful night when her girlfriend, Jill, was kidnapped. She has vowed to never again let anyone separate them. For her, it's Jill and Scarlet to the very end!

The powers given to her by the Hood help her track and hunt down those who would harm the young and innocent. This teenage wall-flower's harmless appearance and dislike for the spotlight give her the edge she needs to pounce on her prey and deal a deadly blow when least expected...

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Indomitus
boardgame.description:
Indomitus is by far and away the most impressive Warhammer box we’ve ever made and it’s arriving this July. The box has been optimised for you veteran hobbyists out there, meaning the whole box is just packed full to the brim with great models and the rules to play – it’s so full, in fact, that Indomitus will save you more than 50% over getting the contents separately. In case you lost track, that’s 61 push-fit miniatures, 1 exclusive launch edition Core Book, the assembly guide and transfer sheet, and the Edge of Silence book with all the rules for your models. We actually packed it so full that we couldn’t fit any dice or tape measures inside – but we know you already have some.

—description from the publisher

The ninth edition starter set features Space Marines versus Necrons.

Game is new in shrinkwrap.

Ken
! Paypal Friend to Friend

boardgame.name: Kitsune
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This beautifully illustrated character playbook for the City of Mist RPG introduces Kitsune, a messenger of good fortune and a trickster fox spirit inhabiting the body of a high-school student.

The City streets are like a forest to Kitsune. They're quick, agile and nimble as a fox, parkouring here-and-there throughout the City streets. Kit can cut through anything (and anyone) standing in their way with their makeshift katana, but their good nature rarely brings them to that. Instead, Kit much rather spread good fortune to those in need.

boardgame.name: Mairead Conroy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This beautifully illustrated character playbook for the City of Mist RPG introduces Mairead Conroy, a child psychologist and the harrowing rift of the Boogeyman, who has sworn to rid the City of the wicked.

Ever since she put on the Boogeyman's Gunny Sack, Mairead Conroy, a child psychologist, can feel the wickedness of people in the City. She feels it radiating off of people like sick heat. Since that fateful day she has decided to protect the innocent and began to hunt the worst of the worst, trying to rid the city of the wicked, while satisfying the Gunny Sack's never-ending hunger...

boardgame.name: "Baby New"
Ben "Buźka" Newman
City of Mist Playbook: Ben "Baby New" Newman
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This beautifully illustrated character playbook for the City of Mist RPG introduces Ben "Baby New" Newman, who is the personification of the year.

Ben was only ever good at one thing: getting away. He’s the kind to leave his troubles infuriated and far behind: teachers, bullies, and now the ladies and cops. He's the best getaway driver in the game, but his awakening and the new condition it brings puts his “career” in jeopardy: he now ages from infancy to old age every year and is reborn on January 1st...

boardgame.name: Fleet Academy: Naval School Wargame
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Fleet Academy, Cadets--the only place where the most prestigious ladies from the world learn the fine art of naval warfare and become the great commanders of the future.
During your studies here, you will engage in live naval conflicts with your fellow students.
The winner will be crowned the top of their class.

In Fleet Academy, players take on the roles of anime girl commanders learning to pilot warships.

GOAL: To sink the other player’s ship.

COMPONENTS: 25 Ocean Cards, 6 Commander Cards, 2 Ship Cards, 3 Equipment Cards,

WHAT YOU NEED: 2 Ship Markers, 6 Stat Trackers (buttons, cubes, etc.), 2 Dice.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Yandere School
boardgame.description:
Akari Furutaka an ordinary yandere schoolgirl,
who fell in love with a guy, but is shy to confess her feelings. At the same time it turns out that a new girl classmate and an exchange student have their eyes for her loved one, and out of nowhere his arranged bride appears, even the school baseball team is competing for his attention! The fight for love will go at any cost…

Features:
• Exciting gameplay; you need to not only put a competitor out of your way, but also to hide the traces of the crime without being seen by witnesses or your sweetheart
• A great love story: inspired by the best examples of Japanese animation, developers created an amazing anime-style 3D stealth action game
• A detailed simulation of school life, complete immersion in the anime world; attend classes, sit at the last desk by the window or walk around hunting down your opponents, have no mercy, in the end senpai will be yours!
• The ability to feel like an ordinary Japanese schoolgirl… and she is yandere!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: CAPERS Offworld
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's the 1920s and earthlings have developed space travel. Nefarious space gangsters strive to steal their piece of the intergalactic pie. Stalwart space cops seek to bring them to justice. And it all happens in high-flying, pulp action among the stars. You are one of these space cops or rocket robbers...and you have super-powers!

Player/GM Supplement

This is a supplement for the BAMFsie Award-Winning CAPERS RPG. It provides a plethora of new character options, GM tools, and an alternative 1920s setting filled with pulp, sci-fi action and adventure.

boardgame.name: CAPERS Offworld: The Good Stuff
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Get a load of the new craze from beyond the stars. All the speakeasies are stocking it. But where is it coming from?

A CAPERS Offworld adventure for 2nd level characters.

boardgame.name: The Mines of Strorburim
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure for use with 5th Edition Dungeons and Dragons.

The Dwarves of the Strorburim mountains are well known for their skill at extracting valauble gems and minerals from their mines. For hundreds of years they supplied much of these valuables to the market place. In the last couple of years, however, the Dwarves have not been seen. What has become of them and their mines?

This is both an outdoor adventure and an underground exploration. Maps have been provided for both elements.

boardgame.name: Orb Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

RELEASE THE ORBS!

This book presents options for you to incorporate an additional magic option into your Pathfinder Second Edition game. Using orbs (corpuscles of extraplanar energy, free of any ties to a spellcasting tradition), any PC can claim powerful magic effects that grow as they level up. Your PCs can gain access to these orbs through the orb channeler archetype (fun for a dip or a full replacement of your class feats) or through magic items.

The orb channeler archetype pairs well with any class, offering benefits to any build or play style. If you’re looking for a dip into magic, the dedication feat alone offers access to a variety of magical effects. If you want to fully dedicate your PC to orb magic, the archetype includes enough feats to replace all of a PC’s class feats.

boardgame.name: Wet Beach Pussies
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A rock-paper-siscors game against 10 different. Your goal is to undress them on the beach playing the game of RPS

boardgame.name: Retro Monster School
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Previous Editions to Fifth Edition

Are you a fan of older edition materials? Are you a writer, developer, or publisher with a need to convert older edition monsters to Fifth Edition? This conversion guide will walk you through the process of creating a simple, first-pass conversion. Mastering this process can save you hours in the long run, letting you focus on thematics, not basic numbers. Retro Monster School offers guidelines for 1E to 4E, as well as Pathfinder 1E. Take note: this is a formidable tome, created by an expert of the craft to guide others seeking an in-depth guide to the art, science, and best practices of converting older edition monsters.

boardgame.name: Of Beasts Brave & True
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This short supplement is for use with The Hero’s Journey, Second Editionnd introduces three new Lineages that allow players to take up the mantle of sentient animal, similar to the Rover Lineage found in The Hero’s Companion. Here, you will find rules to play stalwart horses, mischievous cats, and inquisitive birds, known respectively as the Destrier, the Prowler, and the Windkin. But affection for our furry and feathered friends doesn’t end there! You’ll also find new heirlooms tied to these Lineages, as well as a collection of new beasts to add to your menagerie. There’s even expanded occupations for more traditional two-legged heroes!

boardgame.name: Scorpion infested temple
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A simple, yet deadly encounter in a forgotten, underground temple wich became the lair for a couple of cave scorpions! The file contains a description for the encounter and behaviour of the creatures, three revisited or completely new monsters, and a full page tile to play the battle over it.

The encounter is set for a 4-6 party members of level 5-7.

boardgame.name: Armored Assassins of Alorand
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of levels 6-8

Nothing like a roadside inn, an enjoyable evening of dining & entertainment, and a restful slumber to put one at ease, that is, until floating suits of armor burst into your bedroom and attempt to assassinate you in your sleep!

boardgame.name: Runemaker, Soulbreaker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of levels 6-8

Jyllyra Runa is known throughout the land for her exceptional magic talent. Some tales portray her as foul, others noble, but none of her deeds were done for any underlying ethos or pathos; Jyllyra simply seeks knowledge and power. Born to a great jarl, Jyllyra was raised by an attentive housecarl with a predilection for runic magic. When Jyllyra’s parents were slain in a coup, her housecarl used a teleportation rune to remove the two of them from harm’s way. The duo has since traveled the realm, perfecting their arts. Jyllyra’s area of expertise is rune magic, a primordial force dealing with the arcane flirtations of nature and the gods themselves.

The adventurers may learn about Jyllyra in a local town, be hired to retrieve some item stolen by her, or overhear rumors about a local “witch” that needs to be driven from these lands. Somehow, the characters find themselves standing outside a complex recently established as Jyllyra’s new home for runic experimentation. Little do the adventurers know they have just involuntarily agreed to become test subjects – Jyllyra sees their every move, testing her latent powers and experiments on them.

boardgame.name: Phase Locked
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of levels 5-6

The sleepy town of Dunton no longer sleeps. The moon has been in new moon phase for several days afflicting the inhabitants with supernatural insomnia. Everyone is tired, several are bedridden due to exhaustion.

During the last new moon, a landslide uncovered a smooth stone wall with a moon carving. The moon has not returned since and the characters are asked to investigate.

boardgame.name: Under Krygor Manor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four characters of level 1

The Krygor family has faded away but remains famous for its explorations of the world and collecting treasures. Rumors of a hidden dungeon under a ruined Krygor manor has attracted adventurers to investigate. Thorny brambles cover the landscape and the manor house has mostly collapsed in upon itself; evidence points to storm damage.

boardgame.name: Debilitating Talents 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crack the ground with alteration magic, redirect the flow of blood through an enemy's body, or read someone's fate and force their actions; all of this and more can be yours with the power of Debilitating talents!

For Spheres of Might/Spheres of Power and Pathfinder 1st edition.

boardgame.name: Smartphone KS stretch goals for first edition owners
boardgame.description:
Offered as part of the Kickstarter campaign for the 2nd Edition.

Described as "The Smartphone Inc KS stretch goals for first edition owners" by Cosmodrome.

Contained within the identical box as the Smartphone Inc Kickstarter second edition game.

boardgame.name: Salamander
Salamandra
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every night I see it in my dreams: a great flaming lizard-like thing, black as soot, drenched in rainwater. It tells me that everything is one, that fire and water are the same.
When I finally wake up screaming, I’m lucky if I didn’t burn down the bed. I’ve got a job to get to and I really need that paycheck. What more, there’s a city full of people in need out there and someone needs to protect them from those who want to take advantage of them. So I put all that subconscious junk aside, grab a coffee, and hit the streets.

boardgame.name: Lily Chow and Iron Hans
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Forget it. It’s all a lie, it’s always been a lie. They’re just trying to get me to come back home. They’ve sent private investigators, a therapist, even my best friend. But they don’t give a damn about me. They’ve been hiding the truth: a dark, horrible secret about who they are and what they’ve done. And that’s why I’m never going back.

Hans is different. He cares. He wants me to be my own person and he makes sure I have what I need. And he can do things you wouldn’t believe, insane things! Setting him free was the best thing I ever did. Now I’ve gotta set myself free of my stupid parents.”

Lily Chow is on the run. She has stolen something from the safe in her mother’s office – a Mythos – and she’s not giving him back. Daughter to a high-flying city official and a corporate executive, Lily always knew her parents were involved in shady business but she never suspected their downtown penthouse was the prison of a remarkable being: Iron Hans. When she first met him, she was horrified; nine-foot-tall and covered in long shaggy hair, she could describe him in no other words save “a monster”. But Iron Hans made a deal with her: if she set him free, he would show her the world.

Since then, they have been running from her parents, who are trying to get her and Hans back. They've been shacking in different dumps and abandoned spaces around the Industrial Zone. The iron-skinned magic-wielding pure-energy churl serves as a bodyguard and as a big brother for Lily, who is both scared and exhilarated by life in this part of the City. Whenever she needs him, she just calls out his name three times and he appears. Hans got Lily to change her rich downtown garb for jeans, a tee, and a leather jacket, but underneath the outfit she is still just a spoiled prince in a wild land.

boardgame.name: Flicker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What would you do if one day you're, like, walking down this really cool neighborhood, that used to be kinda rough, but now it's being renovated and all the indie bands are moving there, and there are lots of gigs and really cool people hanging out in the coffee-shops, and a lot of organic co-ops and micro-breweries...

Anyway, what would you do if you were walking there and all of a sudden you'd see the place in a total state of destruction, like burning, with buildings ruined and alarms going off... and the next moment you're back in this really cool neighborhood, all shocked and, you know, PTSD. Oh, and you also get super-speed and space-bending powers. I mean - it’s SO over the top!

boardgame.name: Mitosis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When you’re in the ring, if you’re good, you know that the real challenge is not to get hit. One hit - that’s all it takes. One good hit and you’re down.

Now look at me. There’s no boxer in the world that could mangle me up the way that stuff in the yellow barrels did. There isn’t a word for what I’ve become. Sometimes I think there’s a whole jungle up my ass. It’s disgusting. One good hit is all it took. I’m down, and now I need a way to get myself up again.

boardgame.name: Sōdo Āto Onrain Arishizēshon Rikorisu
SWORD ART ONLINE Alicization Lycoris
Sword Art Online: Alicization Lycoris
ソードアート・オンライン アリシゼーション リコリス
boardgame.description:
Your Journey Is Ready To Begin...

For the first time ever, players can experience SWORD ART ONLINE's anime storyline in game format with SWORD ART ONLINE Alicization Lycoris! Play as the protagonist Kirito and immerse yourself in "Underworld," a mysterious virtual world set in the anime's Alicization arc. Featuring intense battle action, stunning JRPG visuals, and an expansive world to explore; your journey through the latest VRMMO SWORD ART ONLINE game is ready to begin!

Lycoris Flower

Lycoris is a species of flower found in the South of Japan which symbolizes passion, sad memories, reunion, and self-reliance. Experience these themes as you dive into the game's storyline.

Faithful to the Original Work

Kirito has awoken in a mysterious yet somehow familiar virtual world where AIs behave like humans. In this world, Kirito meets a young man named Eugeo. They make a promise where their destinies will soon become entwined. To keep that promise and stay together, they must venture onwards.

Meet your Favorite Characters

Relive the story of Alicization with your favorite characters such as Kirito, Eugeo, Alice, Administrator, and many more.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Monster Hunts: Theros
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Monster Hunts: Theros is a collection of short bounties and plot hooks using creatures from Mythic Odysseys of Theros.

boardgame.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Gambling In/Out Tokens
boardgame.description:
Track your In and Out status during gambling rounds of Red Dragon Inn with these nifty Gambling In/Out tokens designed by Brian Patterson (D20 Monkey).

The IN side is finished with green enamel and shows sweet piles of coins. The OUT side is red enamel and shows nothing but spilled beer and lost hopes.

Each token is 39mm diameter and 2mm thick (the same size as a poker chip), and finished with antique plating and translucent enamel.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: King of the Castle Games Company
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove
The Red Dragon Inn 7: The Tavern Crew

boardgame.name: Malady
boardgame.description:
Malady is an unconventional stacking/sowing game designed by Alek Erickson in May 2020. It is inspired by the games of Arrausi.

Setup: Players play on a hexagonal board. Three colors are involved: White, Black, and Grey (neutral). Players Black and White own stacks with their own color on top. The field is initially filled with single checkers of all 3 colors. The third color may be neutral or owned by a third player. The checkers are tiled so that they are evenly spaced. This game may also be played on a square grid tiled with evenly spaced White and Black checkers.

Players take turn distributing stacks: On your turn, you pick up one stack with your color on top, and immediately place a blockade (stone of your color) on that empty point. Then, distribute the stack. This means for each checker in the stack you are holding, move exactly that many points in a straight line in any direction and drop the bottom checker on that destination. Repeat this process as long as checkers remain in the stack. Note that "any direction" means any of the six hexagonal directions, or, on the square version, any of the eight orthodiagonal directions.

The board gets increasingly restricted: Nobody can drop checkers on points occupied by blockades of either color. While distributing, you may jump over blockades of your color, but not the opponents.

Game end: A player loses when they are unable to make a legal move.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Spirit Island: Broken Token Organizer
boardgame.description:
Invaders from beyond the known sea have upset the natural balance of your once peaceful island. Restore that balance with the official Spirit Island Organizer from The Broken Token for Spirit Island by Greater Than Games.

The untamed wilds find their home among 25 removable trays holding the content from the Spirit Island base game, the Branch and Claw expansion, the Jagged Earth expansion, and the Spirit promo packs 1 and 2.

The Island Boards Tray holds all the modular island boards, as well as houses six individual player trays for each color of player tokens.

The ready-to-play Fear Tray is set directly on the Invader Board as part of setup, and can be rotated to easily reset the fear pool when acquiring fear cards and raising the terror among the invaders.

The Scenario Tray holds the large adversary and scenario panels, as well as the adversary reminder tiles and scenario markers.

There are four card trays, one each for Fear, Event, and Blight card decks and a double card tray for the Minor and Major Power card decks.

There are two each of the Dahan, Invader, and Energy marker trays; one for each side of the game table, good for larger groups.

One more card tray holds the unique powers for each Spirit, with the dividers to organize the cards by Spirit complexity or expansion.

The Spirit Boards Tray holds the Spirit boards, as well as the rules reference cards, reminder cards, and Invader cards.

The last four trays round out the organizer storing the beasts, wilds, disease, strife, badlands, and blight tokens in pairs, and the Element Tray holds the 8 different element markers.

This organizer can be configured in a single box with significant lid lift, or can be split between the original Spirit Island box and the Jagged Earth expansion box, with no lift on either. Or you can upgrade your game further with the Spirit Island: Broken Token Game Crate upgrade.

Accommodates the Following Expansions:

Spirit Island: Branch and Claw (2017)
Spirit Island: Promo Pack 1 (2017)
Spirit Island: Jagged Earth (2020)
Spirit Island: Promo Pack 2 (2020)

This product is a kit that requires assembly.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Spirit Island: Broken Token Game Crate
boardgame.description:
Untamed wilds grow (that’s why they’re called untamed), but your game collection doesn’t have to be. Upgrade your Spirit Island: Broken Token Organizer with this deluxe Craftsman Series game crate. The crate’s lid features the eight different element icons as transparent colored-acrylic windows. Whether your box is worn from so much play or you’re motivated to show proper respect to the island Spirits, this crate upgrade is for you.

GCA038k Want to keep things simple? Get the Spirit Island Organizer and Crate upgrade in one complete package. This single-purchase crate solution accommodates the content from the Spirit Island base game, the Branch and Claw expansion, the Jagged Earth expansion, and the Spirit promo packs 1 and 2. Bundle contents include all the pieces from ORG082 - Spirit Island Organizer and GCA022 - Spirit Island Crate Upgrade.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Alone After the Apocalypse
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A solo roleplaying game about exploring the remnants.

boardgame.name: Alone In a Dark Realm
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A world fallen to darkest fantasy.

You are a solitary shade, floating from waste to waste exploring. Each waste has unique features for you to discover and record.

boardgame.name: Alone In a Neo-City
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a solitary robot, whirring from district to district exploring. Each district has unique features for you to discover and record.

boardgame.name: Alone in a Foreign City
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A solo roleplaying game about exploring a foreign city and learning a new language.

boardgame.name: Alone in a Haunted Building
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A solo roleplaying game about exploring a haunted house.

boardgame.name: alone in a pepper in an eggplant in a bed frame
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

a game of putting things inside of other things inside of other things and leaving no trace.

forever.
boardgame.rpg: alone in a pepper in an eggplant in a bed frame

boardgame.name: beyond the distant dappled lights
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“1st year under the Silver Branch. They say that you’re gone for good, but I cannot bring myself to believe it. How could I? You have already pulled off so many impossible feats during these turbulent years; what is yet another? If anyone could escape this fate, it would be you.

If you see this while I am away, please wait for me here. I shall be back by summer’s end.”

You are a traveller making a journey in the aftermath of a calamity.

boardgame.name: Final Boss
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“1st year under the Silver Branch. They say that you’re gone for good, but I cannot bring myself to believe it. How could I? You have already pulled off so many impossible feats during these turbulent years; what is yet another? If anyone could escape this fate, it would be you.

If you see this while I am away, please wait for me here. I shall be back by summer’s end.”

You are a traveller making a journey in the aftermath of a calamity.

boardgame.name: Heart Shaped Blades
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A game about queer love and fighting back.
...
Mired in the conflicts of which you had no hand in starting, oppressive systems bear down on you from all sides. Merely existing is to fight back. You find the will to move forward in a new power, your Heart Shaped Blade.

Wield It. Survive.

boardgame.name: Traveling the Planes of Desire
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A game of exploring fantastic realms populated by sexual fantasies.

boardgame.name: Alone in the Void
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a solitary explorer sent out to chart forgotten regions of deep space. Each sector of space you travel to has unique phenomena for you to discover, record, and analyze. They are represented by cards from a standard deck, placed face down.

boardgame.name: Up At the Lights
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a retiring professional wrestler. Your life takes place in the ring week after week. You have little control over your win-loss record, your opponent, or match stipulation. Every night that passes is another chance to etch your name in history, as you make your way inevitably to your final match.

boardgame.name: Alone After the Crisis
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It was all so fun. The capes, the powers, the colors. Even the villains, as dangerous and larger-than-life as they seemed, were mostly harmless. The heroes always stepped in to protect people at the right time and the villains were never truly out to hurt anyone at all. It was a Golden Age.

boardgame.name: You're Gonna Carry Them With You
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Amid the turbulent life of the commune, you find a moment of peace. You close your eyes and as so often, your dream takes you to the dead.
boardgame.rpg: You're Gonna Carry Them With You

boardgame.name: The Gateshead Engine
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Gateshead Engine is a single-player game set in an alternate version of Victorian England. In it, you’ll take on the role of an engineer creating a steam-powered mecha for a powerful patron, chronicling your progress, thoughts, and fears in your diary as you go. It can be played in a single session (set aside at least an hour) or split across several nights of play.

boardgame.name: Alone in the Station Remnants
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

you are a solitary scout, sent off to scour the sprawling remains of abandoned mech stations. your orders are clear: find what is useful, find what is damaged, report back to mission command. it is a simple, straightforward task.

but this station is different.

you grew up here; you carry memories of your time here. your first mech. your first crew. your first missions. the memories inexorably linked to your identity as a pilot.

you had a life here, once. but in this moment, you have a job to do.

boardgame.name: Alone Among the Derelicts
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

stripping the bones of derelict starships on the outskirts of the lost republic is how you scrape together a living. your grandparents took pride in these ships as symbols of their nation. you have always been too hungry to feel emotions as complex as pride.

there was a time, perhaps your grandparents’ time, when no one had to go hungry, when the subspace gates did not charge a toll, when no one would call you outskirt slum-scum, when rice and warmth and medicine were free.

it is no longer that time.

boardgame.name: Alone Among the Court
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A solo roleplaying game about navigating the Royal Court.

boardgame.name: Alone in the Labyrinth
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a Cartographer. You wish to map the ever-changing Labyrinth that lies below. It desires to consume all who enter.

boardgame.name: Alone in Your Car
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A verbally-recorded journaling game. Do not play while driving a car in real life.

You’re driving across the country to help a friend get out of a toxic situation. When you want to narrate your actions, roll a d6 to determine what time of day it is.

boardgame.name: Alone in the Beautiful Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a solitary "monster", moving from area to area exploring. Each area has unique features for you to discover and record.

boardgame.name: Confidence of the Stars
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a tiny spark in a vast universe. One person among billions. On one planet among countless. Every now and then, a star falls and you make a wish.

boardgame.name: Alone at the Nascent Cyberscape
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a solitary A.I. or Digital Avatar, traversing the start of a digital realm. Each server has unique features for you to discover and record.

boardgame.name: Alone at an Altar
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are the prophet of a god, their mouthpiece in this world, translating their unknowable voice to those who can’t hear them. Each prophecy comes to you in impressions of images, musical melodies, flashes of color and light and scent. You must do your best to interpret these visions into something others can understand.

To receive a new prophecy, roll a six-sided die and place cards face down equal to the number rolled.

boardgame.name: Florists Alone
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Dungeon Flowers - You are a solitary Dungeon Master turned Florist, roaming from dungeon to dungeon.

Detective Flowers - You are a solitary Odds and Ends (non-criminal) Detective turned Florist, meandering from locale to locale.

Chosen Flower - You are a solitary Chosen Hero turned Florist, slipping from town to town.

boardgame.name: ☼Alone Before Bedtime☾
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are a solitary individual, about to get some rest. To wind down, you will tell a bedtime story through play. Each chapter of your story is represented by cards from a standard playing card deck, placed face down.

boardgame.name: Alone in Cyberspace
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

During the 1990’s there were many web hosting services, such as Geocities and Homestead, that allowed people to easily create their own personal web pages. People often made pages about their sports teams, politics, or tributes to loved ones, and these pages were often linked to others on the service. Before social media networks like MySpace and Facebook existed, these were places where people could create spaces to express themselves.

You are alone at your computer, exploring the archived pages of one of these defunct services from the late 90’s. Each page is unique, a reflection of the person who created it.

boardgame.name: Alone at the Twilight of One World and the Dawn of Another
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are the lone survivor, or the only survivor you are aware of, of a world dying, or already dead but yet to decay. There is not much left to do but to revisit the places important to you when the world still had life, and record your memories and what has changed about the location. Each location is represented by a card from a standard deck, drawn when you find a new location.
boardgame.rpg: Alone at the Twilight of One World and the Dawn of Another

boardgame.name: Alone with the Sun & Wind I Sing of My Years
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are an old musical instrument...

...left sitting out for a moment, softly lit by the sun, the wind blowing through you and coaxing out a song. Each reflection across your body and each note you sing hints at some part of your story. While the wind blows yet, recount your history in pieces, considering the ways you’ve changed over the years.
boardgame.rpg: Alone with the Sun & Wind I Sing of My Years

Invented in medieval Scotland, the peculiar sport of Curling has reached the Olympic Games only in 1998 as regular event. In this game we have added also the two edition of 1988 and 1992 where it
was a demonstrative sport.

The Robotech: Macross Saga RPG is 264 pages of amazing full color art goodness. Fans of Robotech will not be disappointed. Along with the rules, is a 50 page Scenario section that outlines the entire Robotech: Macross Saga. Take action along with your favorite heroes or villains, or play as them. The unique system allows for personal level, mecha level, and naval level action. Take on conflicts and drama to secure your future and get the SDF-1 home. Every turn, with every action, you have something interesting to do.


264 Page, Full Color Hardback Book
Play as your favorite Macross Saga Character, or make up your own.
Pilot any Mecha, Vehicle, or Naval Vessel from the Macross Saga.
150+ Original Art Images!
Free PDF copy from DTRPG!
Written by Jeff Mechlinski & Bryan Young


Along with the amazing art and scenarios are short stories about the Robotech Universe. Immerse yourself in the fiction.

Robotech: The Macross Saga The Roleplaying Game
Official 4-Panel Game Master Screen

4 Panels
The GM Side features all the most pertinent info needed when playing
